column3: 1.Have you ever participated in an outdoor or adventure event (e.g., surfing, hiking, horseback riding, skiing)?
column4: 2.Which of the events have you ever attended?
column9: 3.How many times per year do you typically attend such events?
column10: 4.What is your main motivation for attending these events?
column11: 5.How important is the event’s overall cost to you?
column12: 6.How important is the environment’s visual and thematic appeal to you?
column13: 7.How important is a scenic, easily accessible location when choosing an event?
column14: 8.How important are additional amenities (e.g., food, music, freebies) to your enjoyment?
column15: 9.How important is having a range of different activities within the same event?
column26: 20.I’m willing to pay more if the visuals and the atmosphere of the event is particularly outstanding.
column27: 21.I would pay more if the location is especially convenient or attractive.
column28: 22.High-quality amenities (food, music, etc.) leads to accepting higher prices for me.
column29: 23.I value a wide variety of activities enough to pay more.
column30: 24.I’d rather have one excellent, well-managed activity with great atmosphere, than multiple average ones.
column31: 25.I prefer a basic location if it offers great amenities (e.g., quality food, music).
column32: 26.If all these factors (Price, Visual Appeal, Location, Amenities, Variety of Activites) are ideal, I am willing to pay a higher price.
column33: 27.Which single factor most often influences your decision to attend an event?
column34: 28.Which of these statements best describes your attitude towards paying for events?
column35: 29.I often decide whether to attend an event based on friends’ or social media recommendations.
column36: 30.If you found an event that matched all your preferences, how likely would you recommend it to others?
